title: Online learning under one sided $$\sigma $$ -smooth function
abstract:
The online optimization model was first introduced in the research of machine learning problems (Zinkevich, Proceedings of ICML, 928–936, 2003). It is a powerful framework that combines the principles of optimization with the challenges of online decision-making. The present research mainly consider the case that the reveal objective functions are convex or submodular. In this paper, we focus on the online maximization problem under a special objective function $$\varPhi (x):[0,1]^nightarrow \mathbb {R}_{+}$$ which satisfies the inequality $$ rac{1}{2}\langle u^{T}

Firstly, under the assumption that the gradient function of OSS function is L-smooth, we propose an $$(1-\exp ((	heta -1)(	heta /(1+	heta ))^{2\sigma }))$$ - approximation algorithm with $$O(\sqrt{T})$$ regret upper bound, where T is the number of rounds in the online algorithm and $$	heta , \sigma \in \mathbb {R}_{+}$$ are parameters. Secondly, if the gradient function of OSS function has no L-smoothness, we provide an $$\left( 1+((	heta +1)/	heta )^{4\sigma }ight) ^{-1}$$ -approximation projected gradient algorithm, and prove that the regret upper bound of the algorithm is $$O(\sqrt{T})$$ . We think that this research can provide different ideas for online non-convex and non-submodular learning.
